description: The ocean covers 70% of the Earth’s surface and, through its interaction with the atmosphere, plays a key role in Earth’s climate. This course explores how marine ecosystems respond to, and play a role in, climate variability. We will examine factors regulating oceanic productivity, including how large-scale, coupled oceanographic/atmospheric processes, such as El Niño and the Pacific Decadal Oscillation, affect food webs from plankton to commercially-harvested fish. This course will also look at the influence of anthropogenic climate change on the stability and productivity of marine ecosystems.
title: Effects of Climate on Marine Ecosystems
